intro: Neomammillaria marshalliana, commonly known as the Marshall's milk barrel cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
